SEARCH
Package com.api.synco.module.authentication.application.controller

Class AuthenticationController

java.lang.Object
com.api.synco.module.authentication.application.controller.AuthenticationController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/auth") public class AuthenticationController extends Object
REST controller for authentication operations.

This controller provides endpoints for user authentication including:

  • User registration (creating new accounts)
  • User login (obtaining JWT tokens)
  • Password reset (changing authenticated user's password)

The registration and login endpoints are publicly accessible, while password reset requires authentication.

Since:
1.0.0
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Luca5Eckert

  • Method Details

    • register

      @PostMapping("/register") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CustomApiResponse<UserRegisterResponse>> register(@RequestBody @Valid @Valid UserRegisterRequest userRegisterRequest)
      Registers a new user in the system.

      This endpoint is publicly accessible and creates a new user account with the USER role.

      Parameters:
      userRegisterRequest - the request containing user registration data
      Returns:
      the created user data with HTTP 201 status

    • login

      @PostMapping("/login") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CustomApiResponse<UserLoginResponse>> login(@RequestBody @Valid @Valid UserLoginRequest userLoginRequest)
      Authenticates a user and returns a JWT token.

      This endpoint validates user credentials and returns a JWT token that can be used for accessing protected endpoints.

      Parameters:
      userLoginRequest - the request containing login credentials
      Returns:
      the login response with JWT token and HTTP 202 status

    • resetPassword

      @PatchMapping("/password") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CustomApiResponse<Void>> resetPassword(@RequestBody @Valid @Valid UserResetRequest userResetRequest)
      Resets the password for the authenticated user.

      This endpoint requires authentication. The user must provide their current password for verification before setting a new password.

      Parameters:
      userResetRequest - the request containing current and new passwords
      Returns:
      success message with HTTP 202 status
